title.native: 鎧伝サムライトルーパー

description:
Thousands of years ago, the evil emperor Talpa attempted to conquer the Earth. Defeated, he was banished to the Nether Realm and his armor was divided into 9 separate suits. Now, he has returned to conquer Earth, having reclaimed 4 of the suits. The other 5 are in the possesion of those who are the only hope of stopping him: The Ronin Warriors.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B1%A0%E7%94%B0%E6%88%90)

Masashi Ikeda is a director, screenwriter and storyboard artist.

Noted for directing [Mobile Suit Gundam Wing](https://anilist.co/anime/90/), [Vampire Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/1952/) and the first 44 episodes of [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/). He is a former member of an amateur anime production circle "Group Ebisen," together with [Hiroyuki Kakudou](https://anilist.co/staff/141183/), [Kouji Yamamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101065/), [Keiko Fukuyama](https://anilist.co/staff/159650/), [Sunao Katabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/103947/), [Umanosuke Iida](Umanosuke Iida) and Takuya Ishida.

Perhaps most well known for his work as a character designer on the anime television series [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/). He was also one of the founding members of [Oh! Production](https://anilist.co/studio/234/), together with [Kouichi Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/191548/), [Kazuo Komatsubara](https://anilist.co/staff/129558/), and Koushin Yonekawa.

In 1966, Shioyama joined Hatena Pro under the direction of [Bonjin Nagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/117141/). Shioyama later became a freelancer, doing work for [Tatsunoko Pro](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) and working on many projects for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as an animation director. Shioyama's first project as a character designer was for [Invincible Steel Man Daitarn 3](https://anilist.co/anime/3305/), which anime director [Ryousuke Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100957/) praised. He then worked on such shows as [Fang of the Sun Dougram](https://anilist.co/anime/2257/), [Panzer World Galient](https://anilist.co/anime/5153/), and [Ronin Warriors](https://anilist.co/anime/1264/) as both character designer and animation director. His and Takahashi's designs epitomized Sunrise's work in the '80s.

On April 13, 2017, a fire occurred at Shioyama's apartment in Misato, sadly killing both him and his wife.

Perhaps most well known for his work as a character designer on the anime television series [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/). He was also one of the founding members of [Oh! Production](https://anilist.co/studio/234/), together with [Kouichi Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/191548/), [Kazuo Komatsubara](https://anilist.co/staff/129558/), and Koushin Yonekawa.

In 1966, Shioyama joined Hatena Pro under the direction of [Bonjin Nagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/117141/). Shioyama later became a freelancer, doing work for [Tatsunoko Pro](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) and working on many projects for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as an animation director. Shioyama's first project as a character designer was for [Invincible Steel Man Daitarn 3](https://anilist.co/anime/3305/), which anime director [Ryousuke Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100957/) praised. He then worked on such shows as [Fang of the Sun Dougram](https://anilist.co/anime/2257/), [Panzer World Galient](https://anilist.co/anime/5153/), and [Ronin Warriors](https://anilist.co/anime/1264/) as both character designer and animation director. His and Takahashi's designs epitomized Sunrise's work in the '80s.

On April 13, 2017, a fire occurred at Shioyama's apartment in Misato, sadly killing both him and his wife.

He is a pianist, keyboardist, composer and arranger. Totsuka graduated from the Department of Politics at Keio University.

He studied music with Hayashi Masahiko, Kitagawa Yuu, Watanabe Sadao and Fujii Sadayasu. In the '70s, after leaving school, he worked with Yagami Junko (famous J-pop singer) as an arranger. Together, they made a hit record "Omoide wa Utsukushisugite". In the '90s, he worked as an accompanist for Graciela Susana, Amano Noriko, Katou Kunihiko, and worked with a number of chanteuse, jazz singers.

Totsuka is a member of Japan Composers & Arrangers Association (JCAA), and a regular member of Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers (JASRAC).

(Source: AniDB)

He studied music with Hayashi Masahiko, Kitagawa Yuu, Watanabe Sadao and Fujii Sadayasu. In the '70s, after leaving school, he worked with Yagami Junko (famous J-pop singer) as an arranger. Totsuka is a member of Japan Composers & Arrangers Association (JCAA), and a regular member of Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers (JASRAC).

(Source: AniDB)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MichiakiKato)__

__Michiaki Katou__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and guitarist.

He is a pianist, keyboardist, composer and arranger. Totsuka graduated from the Department of Politics at Keio University.

He studied music with Hayashi Masahiko, Kitagawa Yuu, Watanabe Sadao and Fujii Sadayasu. In the '70s, after leaving school, he worked with Yagami Junko (famous J-pop singer) as an arranger. Together, they made a hit record "Omoide wa Utsukushisugite". In the '90s, he worked as an accompanist for Graciela Susana, Amano Noriko, Katou Kunihiko, and worked with a number of chanteuse, jazz singers.

Totsuka is a member of Japan Composers & Arrangers Association (JCAA), and a regular member of Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers (JASRAC).

(Source: AniDB)
